study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of Lipiodol (an oil-soluble contrast media containing iodine) in evaluating tubal patency and enhancing fertility through therapeutic tubal flushing.
results_summary: The study found that Lipiodol improved fertility outcomes and recommended a modified hysterosalpingogram (HSG) technique with supplementary ultrasound for better safety and technical handling.
population_specificity: Not specified (likely women undergoing fertility assessment/treatment).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the use of Iodine-125 (I-125) brachytherapy as an adjuvant treatment for recurrent high-grade meningiomas after resection.
results_summary: Several case series report good long-term survival with I-125 brachytherapy, suggesting its potential usefulness for recurrent high-grade meningiomas, though complications like radiation necrosis, impaired wound healing, hydrocephalus, and infection can occur. No controlled studies comparing treatment with or without brachytherapy were available.
population_specificity: Patients with recurrent high-grade meningiomas after resection.

study_goal: The researchers reviewed surgical and therapeutic approaches for pediatric differentiated thyroid carcinomas (DTCs), including the role of iodine deficiency and targeted therapies for iodine-refractory disease.
results_summary: Pediatric DTCs are associated with iodine deficiency among other risk factors. The study highlights the use of targeted therapies for iodine-refractory and surgically unresectable progressive disease.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients with differentiated thyroid carcinomas (DTCs).

study_goal: The researchers were evaluating the use of fractional CO₂ laser treatment for primary palmoplantar hyperhidrosis (PPH), with iodine starch tests used as an assessment tool.
results_summary: The study compared treated and untreated palms in three PPH patients over two sessions. Results were assessed using the minor iodine starch test and VAS, but specific outcomes regarding iodine were not detailed.
population_specificity: Three patients with primary palmoplantar hyperhidrosis (PPH).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of different antiseptic agents, including iodine, in preventing postcaesarean infections.
results_summary: The study found that chlorhexidine gluconate was slightly more effective than povidone iodine in reducing surgical site infections, but evidence for other outcomes was inconclusive or of low certainty. Iodine alone showed no clear advantage over combinations like parachlorometaxylenol with iodine.
population_specificity: Women undergoing caesarean section (6,938 participants across 13 trials).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness and tolerability of povidone-iodine sinus irrigations versus mupirocin and saline in treating acute exacerbations of chronic rhinosinusitis in post-surgery patients.
results_summary: Povidone-iodine showed a lower post-treatment culture negativity rate (43%) compared to mupirocin (70%) but was similar to saline (47%). It was well-tolerated at 1% concentration, with no serious adverse effects reported.
population_specificity: Post-surgery patients with acute exacerbations of chronic rhinosinusitis and gram-positive bacteria on culture.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of olanexidine versus aqueous povidone-iodine in reducing surgical site infections (SSI) following clean-contaminated surgery.
results_summary: Olanexidine significantly reduced the 30-day SSI rate (7%) compared to povidone-iodine (13%), with similar adverse skin reaction rates (2% in both groups). The study concluded that olanexidine might be more effective in preventing SSI in clean-contaminated surgeries.
population_specificity: Patients aged 20 years or older undergoing elective clean-contaminated gastrointestinal and hepatobiliary pancreatic surgeries in four Japanese hospitals.
effective_dosage: 10% aqueous povidone-iodine applied once before surgery.
study_duration: Single application before surgery, with outcomes assessed over 30 days post-surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the current understanding of the thyroid tumor microenvironment and its role in thyroid tumor pathogenesis, particularly in cases resistant to standard treatments like surgical resection or radioactive iodine.
results_summary: The abstract highlights the poor prognosis for patients with anaplastic thyroid cancer and the need for better risk identification and less morbid treatments. It emphasizes the role of the tumor microenvironment in driving tumor progression and therapy resistance but does not provide specific findings on iodine's effects.
population_specificity: Patients with thyroid cancer, particularly those with anaplastic or treatment-resistant forms.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize genetic alterations and dysregulated pathways in thyroid cancer and discuss targeted therapies and immunotherapy for advanced, iodine-refractory thyroid cancer.
results_summary: The abstract highlights the lack of effective treatments for advanced, iodine-refractory thyroid cancer despite advances in molecular testing and targeted therapies. It emphasizes the need for further research into promising anti-tumor therapies.
population_specificity: Patients with advanced and metastatic, iodine-refractory thyroid cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical utility of dual-energy spectral computed tomography (DESCT) in assessing thoracic malignancies, including iodine concentration measurement.
results_summary: The abstract highlights DESCT's capabilities, such as virtual monoenergetic imaging and iodine concentration measurement, but does not provide specific findings on iodine's effects.
population_specificity: Patients with thoracic malignancies (specific details not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to report a rare case of anaplastic thyroid carcinoma with rhabdoid phenotype and assess the clinical course and treatment response, including adjuvant radioactive iodine.
results_summary: The study found that the patient developed pulmonary metastasis despite adjuvant radioactive iodine treatment, indicating limited efficacy in this rare variant of thyroid cancer. The case was unusual due to the absence of gross extrathyroidal extension or nodal/distant metastasis at presentation.
population_specificity: A 44-year-old female with anaplastic thyroid carcinoma with rhabdoid phenotype.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the standard management options for low-risk differentiated thyroid cancer, including the role of radioactive iodine (RAI) therapy.
results_summary: The study highlights that surgery is the primary treatment for differentiated thyroid cancer, with RAI therapy used for post-surgical ablation, adjuvant therapy, and recurrent disease treatment, though its routine use is debated due to conflicting data on benefits.
population_specificity: Patients with low-risk differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of iodine-based skin antiseptic solutions (SASs) compared to other antiseptic techniques (e.g., chlorhexidine and alcohol) for preventing surgical site infections in foot and ankle procedures.
results_summary: The abstract suggests mixed evidence for iodine-based solutions, with some studies supporting combined chlorhexidine and alcohol as superior, while others indicate potential advantages for iodine-based alternatives, particularly in forefoot procedures. The primary outcome measured was bacterial growth from skin swab cultures post-preparation.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing orthopedic foot and ankle surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to highlight the rare complication of acute compartment syndrome due to hypothyroidism, specifically after thyroid hormone withdrawal in preparation for radioactive iodine therapy.
results_summary: The study reported two cases of acute compartment syndrome following thyroid hormone withdrawal, emphasizing the need for physician awareness of this rare complication. Both cases required emergency fasciotomy, with varying degrees of muscle necrosis.
population_specificity: Two patients (59-year-old male and 62-year-old female) with hypothyroidism due to thyroid hormone withdrawal.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of povidone-iodine (PVP-I) for nasal and oral decontamination against SARS-CoV-2 and other coronaviruses.
results_summary: PVP-I was found to be safe for nasal use at concentrations up to 1.25% and oral use up to 2.5% for durations of 5 and 6 months, respectively. It rapidly inactivates coronaviruses, including SARS and MERS, within 15 seconds, though direct efficacy against SARS-CoV-2 remains unconfirmed in vitro.
population_specificity: Conscious adults and children.
effective_dosage: Nasal: up to 1.25%; Oral: up to 2.5%.
study_duration: Up to 5 months (nasal), up to 6 months (oral).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the use of radioactive iodide treatment (RAIT) in differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC), clarify terminology, and introduce the TRUC method for identifying occult residual DTC.
results_summary: The study detailed the radiotheragnostics paradigm, proposed standardized terminology for RAIT (remnant ablation, adjuvant treatment, treatment of known disease), and demonstrated the TRUC method's utility in distinguishing benign remnants from occult residual DTC.
population_specificity: Patients with differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC), particularly post-total thyroidectomy cases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the evolution and safety profile of iodine-based contrast media in cardiovascular procedures.
results_summary: Early iodine-based contrast agents had high ionic and osmolar concentrations, leading to significant side effects. Newer agents with lower ionic concentrations and osmolarity are better tolerated with fewer major side effects.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing invasive and interventional cardiovascular procedures.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the reclassification of certain thyroid tumors as NIFTP and discuss its histological and molecular background.
results_summary: The study highlights the indolent nature of some thyroid tumors previously classified as PTC, leading to their reclassification as NIFTP to prevent overtreatment. It also examines the genetic basis and molecular markers for diagnosing NIFTP.
population_specificity: Patients with encapsulated/well-circumscribed follicular thyroid lesions exhibiting PTC nuclear features.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a dental varnish containing polyvinylpyrrolidone-iodine (PVP-I) and sodium fluoride (NaF) was more effective than NaF alone in preventing new dental caries lesions in children.
results_summary: The study found that the PVP-I and NaF varnish significantly reduced caries lesion increments in primary molars at year 1 compared to NaF alone, though the effect was less pronounced by year 2. No harms were reported, and the varnish was effective in primary prevention but not for already cavitated teeth.
population_specificity: Healthy children aged 49 to 84 months enrolled in early childhood education in Pohnpei State, Federated States of Micronesia.
effective_dosage: 10% PVP-I and 5.0% NaF applied every 3 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the current status and recent developments in clinical trials for PET alternatives to [123I]MIBG for imaging hNET-expressing tumors.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that [123I]MIBG, while commonly used, has limitations such as poorer spatial resolution, lower sensitivity, and a two-day imaging protocol. PET alternatives are being explored to overcome these drawbacks.
population_specificity: Patients with neural crest tumors (e.g., neuroblastoma, paraganglioma, pheochromocytoma) expressing hNET.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether increased intake of Atlantic cod (a source of iodine) during pregnancy influenced total hair mercury (THHg) concentrations while improving iodine status.
results_summary: The study found that THHg concentrations remained low in both groups, with a slight increase in the intervention group but no significant rise in participants exceeding the US EPA reference dose. The intervention did not lead to adverse effects related to mercury exposure.
population_specificity: Pregnant women (n=137) in gestational weeks 20-36.
effective_dosage: 400 g of cod fillets per week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether chronic low-dose exposure to perchlorate from food and drinks causes thyroid dysfunction, particularly in sensitive populations.
results_summary: The study found that perchlorate exposure affects thyroid hormone synthesis, especially in infants, adolescents, and adults with underlying thyroid diseases or iodine insufficiency, and may impair neurocognitive development in infants when exposure occurs during pregnancy.
population_specificity: Infants, adolescents, adults, and pregnant women, particularly those with thyroid diseases or iodine insufficiency.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of different iodine dose strategies (fixed low, fixed high, and calculated dose) on ophthalmic complications in patients with Graves' disease.
results_summary: The calculated dose (5.55 MBq/g) showed fewer ophthalmic complications compared to the high fixed dose and was more effective than the low fixed dose, with response rates of 92.9%, 94.4%, and 66.7% respectively. The high fixed dose group had significantly increased proptosis and clinical activity scores.
population_specificity: 92 patients (58 female, 34 male) with Graves' disease and no or inactive ophthalmopathy (mean age 38.2 ± 12.0 years).
effective_dosage: Fixed low dose (259 MBq), fixed high dose (555 MBq), and calculated dose (5.55 MBq/g of thyroid weight, mean 240.5 MBq).
study_duration: 6 months post-treatment follow-up for initial measurements, 12 months for thyroid function and clinical examination.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of an anti-infective treatment for severe periodontitis, which included povidone-iodine as an antiseptic.
results_summary: The study found that the proposed treatment, including povidone-iodine, significantly reduced or eliminated major periodontal pathogens and was deemed acceptably safe. The combination of systemic antibiotics and antiseptics like iodine showed clinical relevance in managing severe periodontitis.
population_specificity: Patients with severe periodontitis.

study_goal: The researchers examined the progress of antiangiogenic treatments, including iodine-131 metaiodobenzylguanidine, for metastatic pheochromocytomas and paragangliomas.
results_summary: High-specific-activity iodine-131 metaiodobenzylguanidine is approved for treating these tumors, but not all patients are candidates. Antiangiogenic medications show promise but face limitations like cardiovascular toxicity and resistance.
population_specificity: Patients with metastatic pheochromocytomas and paragangliomas.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the clinical outcomes and treatment sequencing of first-line lenvatinib and subsequent therapies in patients with radioactive iodine-refractory differentiated thyroid cancer (RAI-r DTC).
results_summary: The study found that first-line lenvatinib had an objective response rate (ORR) of 64.8% in patients still on treatment and 53.6% in those who progressed to second-line therapy. Median progression-free survival was 14.0 months, and overall survival rates at 12, 18, and 24 months were 92.8%, 81.5%, and 66.9%, respectively.
population_specificity: Patients with radioactive iodine-refractory differentiated thyroid cancer (RAI-r DTC), predominantly female, with papillary DTC and lung metastases.
study_duration: Follow-up through October 17, 2018 (initiation from January 1, 2016, to May 31, 2017).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of chlorhexidine-alcohol solution versus povidone-iodine solution in preventing pin-site infections in patients with external fixators.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in infection rates between the two antiseptic solutions, indicating both are equally effective. However, infection risk increased with longer fixator duration.
population_specificity: Patients with external fixators in a single Spanish hospital.
study_duration: Not specified (study conducted from November 2018 to May 2019).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate a low radiation dose, high temporal resolution cardiac cine CT protocol using iodine contrast in human cardiac CT and phantom scans.
results_summary: The study found that multi-segment (MS) reconstructions reduced motion artifacts compared to half-scan (HS) reconstructions, improved visualization of LV late diastolic filling, and provided more physiologic LV free wall systolic motion with less error.
population_specificity: 55 human subjects undergoing cardiac cine CT scans.
effective_dosage: Not specified (iodine used as contrast agent, not as a supplement).

study_goal: To determine if vaginal cleansing with antiseptic solutions like povidone-iodine before cesarean delivery reduces maternal infectious morbidities such as endometritis and wound complications.
results_summary: Vaginal preparation with povidone-iodine or chlorhexidine significantly reduced post-cesarean endometritis (from 7.1% to 3.1%), postoperative fever, and wound infection, with no reported adverse effects.
population_specificity: Women undergoing cesarean delivery across 10 countries.
effective_dosage: Not specified (various methods like sponge sticks, douches, or soaked gauze wipes were used).
study_duration: Single application immediately before cesarean delivery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of various oral care solutions, including povidone-iodine, in preventing oral mucositis in cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy or radiotherapy.
results_summary: The study found that honey and curcumin were more effective than povidone-iodine in preventing oral mucositis, with povidone-iodine ranking lower in efficacy compared to other treatments.
population_specificity: Cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy or radiotherapy (1861 patients across 28 RCTs).

study_goal: The researchers compared the diagnostic performance of contrast-enhanced ultrasound (CEUS), CT, and MRI in evaluating unclear renal lesions, particularly noting CEUS's safety for patients with iodine or gadolinium allergies.
results_summary: CEUS demonstrated high sensitivity (99.1%) and specificity (80.5%) in differentiating malignant from benign renal lesions, comparable to CT and MRI, with particular benefits for patients contraindicated for iodine or gadolinium-based imaging.
population_specificity: 255 patients (ages 18–86) with unclear renal masses.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify gene expression changes in thyroid tissue and blood related to radiation exposure (iodine-131 and other sources) and distinguish radiation-induced thyroid cancers from spontaneous ones.
results_summary: The study examined gene expression changes in thyroid tissue and blood due to radiation exposure, focusing on dose-response relationships and potential links to clinical outcomes like cardiovascular disease. Results were discussed in terms of translating mechanistic data into actionable knowledge for radiation protection or clinical use.
population_specificity: Ukrainian-American thyroid cancer cohort (Chernobyl exposure) and Mayak Production Association radiation workers (external gamma/internal plutonium exposure).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to provide an overview of the current standard of care for pediatric differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC), including the use of radioactive iodine (RAI) treatment, and highlight available targeted therapies for progressive or RAI-refractory DTC.
results_summary: The abstract indicates that RAI treatment is part of the standard care for pediatric DTC when indicated, and it mentions the availability of targeted therapies for advanced or RAI-refractory cases. Molecular changes and potential therapeutic targets in pediatric thyroid cancer are also discussed.
population_specificity: Children with differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC), particularly childhood cancer survivors and those with advanced or RAI-refractory disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the benefits, toxicity, and therapeutic value of high-specific-activity iodine 131 metaiodobenzylguanidine (HSA-I-131-MIBG) for treating metastatic pheochromocytomas and paragangliomas expressing the noradrenaline transporter.
results_summary: The study found that HSA-I-131-MIBG demonstrated an impressive clinical benefit rate, acceptable toxicity, and long-term benefits for the targeted tumors. It also highlighted its potential therapeutic value for other malignancies like neuroblastoma and medullary thyroid carcinoma.
population_specificity: Patients with metastatic pheochromocytomas and paragangliomas expressing the noradrenaline transporter.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of iodine-based antiseptic solutions (10% povidone-iodine and 0.7% iodine povacrylex in 74% isopropyl alcohol) versus chlorhexidine solutions in reducing surgical site infections and unplanned reoperations after fracture repair.
results_summary: The abstract describes the study design and objectives but does not report results, as the trials (Aqueous-PREP and PREPARE) are ongoing.
population_specificity: Patients with open extremity fractures (Aqueous-PREP) and patients with open extremity fractures or closed lower extremity/pelvic fractures (PREPARE).
effective_dosage: 10% povidone-iodine (Aqueous-PREP); 0.7% iodine povacrylex in 74% isopropyl alcohol (PREPARE).
study_duration: Follow-up for outcomes (surgical site infections, reoperations) occurs within 12 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether CT texture analysis of iodine contrast uptake in intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma (iCC) could predict treatment response and survival outcomes after trans-arterial radioembolisation (TARE).
results_summary: The study found that iCCs with higher iodine contrast uptake and more homogeneous distribution in the arterial phase were more likely to respond effectively to TARE, with a favourable radiomic signature associated with longer progression-free survival (12.1 vs. 5.1 months).
population_specificity: 55 patients with intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma (iCC) undergoing TARE.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of adjunctive tolvaptan therapy on cardiac sympathetic nerve activity (CSNA) in acute decompensated heart failure (ADHF) patients with preserved left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF), using iodine-123 metaiodobenzylguanidine (MIBG) imaging.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in cardiac MIBG imaging results between the tolvaptan and conventional diuretic therapy groups overall. However, in patients with higher weight reduction, conventional therapy was associated with lower cardiac MIBG uptake, while tolvaptan therapy did not show this effect, suggesting it may provide decongestion without harmful CSNA effects.
population_specificity: 51 consecutive ADHF patients with LVEF ≥45%.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of dilute povidone-iodine (PI) lavage in preventing postoperative infections after total joint arthroplasties (TJAs).
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in overall or deep postoperative infection rates between patients who received PI lavage and those who did not, across various subgroup analyses. The pooled odds ratios for infection rates were not statistically significant.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing total joint arthroplasties (total hip or knee arthroplasty, primary or aseptic revision).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the progress of countries in the Eastern Mediterranean Region toward eradicating iodine deficiency disorders (IDD) and recommend actions to support WHO's Regional Nutrition Strategy.
results_summary: The study found significant progress in salt iodization in the Eastern Mediterranean Region, with several countries achieving or nearing IDD elimination. Efficient monitoring and multi-sectoral coordination were emphasized to sustain these achievements.
population_specificity: School-aged children (6-12 years) in the Eastern Mediterranean Region.

study_goal: To evaluate the efficacy and safety of a topical ophthalmic suspension combining povidone-iodine 0.6% and dexamethasone 0.1% for treating bacterial conjunctivitis.
results_summary: The study found no significant additional clinical efficacy of PVP-I/DEX compared to placebo, with 50.5% clinical resolution vs. 42.8% for placebo (P = .127). Bacterial eradication rates were also similar (43.3% vs. 46.8%, P = .500). Adverse events were more frequent with PVP-I/DEX (32.8%) and PVP-I alone (39.8%) than placebo (19.0%), though most were mild.
population_specificity: Subjects of all ages with bacterial conjunctivitis (mean age 44.3 years, 61.2% female, 78.1% white).
effective_dosage: Povidone-iodine 0.6% combined with dexamethasone 0.1%, applied topically (frequency not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare quality of life (QoL) between patients with papillary thyroid microcarcinoma (PTMC) who underwent total thyroidectomy (TT) alone versus TT with radioactive iodine (RAI) ablation.
results_summary: Patients who underwent TT with RAI ablation experienced more health-related problems and lower QoL compared to those managed with TT alone, suggesting RAI ablation may negatively impact well-being in low-risk PTMC cases.
population_specificity: Patients with papillary thyroid microcarcinoma (PTMC) who underwent total thyroidectomy with or without RAI ablation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the frequency and predictors of local treatment failure and enucleation after iodine-125 brachytherapy in patients with ocular melanoma.
results_summary: The study found that local treatment failure and enucleation were relatively infrequent, with 5-year Kaplan-Meier estimates of 10.3% and 12.5%, respectively. Risk factors included tumor thickness, proximity to the foveal avascular zone, and poorer baseline visual acuity.
population_specificity: Patients with ocular melanoma (tumors 2.5–10.0 mm in apical height and ≤16.0 mm in longest basal dimension).
study_duration: Follow-up ranged from 1 to over 5 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical impact of pre-ablation rhTSH-stimulated F-18 FDG PET/CT in addition to post-therapeutic whole-body radioiodine scanning in patients with intermediate to high-risk differentiated thyroid carcinoma (DTC).
results_summary: The study found that pre-ablation rhTSH-stimulated F-18 FDG PET/CT provided clinical benefit in about 20% of patients, leading to changes in treatment plans for 15% of patients. It identified discrepancies between F-18 FDG avid lesions and iodine-positive lesions, influencing management decisions.
population_specificity: 73 patients with intermediate to high-risk DTC (44 females, mean age 43.2±16.2 years, 62% papillary, 31% follicular, 7% poorly differentiated).
effective_dosage: Mean activity of 3661±673 MBq I-131 for radioiodine treatment; F-18 FDG PET/CT at 4 MBq/kg body weight.

study_goal: The researchers evaluated the effectiveness of povidone-iodine as a prophylactic strategy to prevent postinjection endophthalmitis during intravitreal injections.
results_summary: Povidone-iodine applied to the ocular surface before injection was found to be the most effective technique for preventing infection, though aqueous chlorhexidine was noted as an acceptable alternative. Other strategies, such as minimizing oral flora exposure and using prefilled syringes, also reduced infection risk, while topical antibiotics and certain procedural elements (e.g., drapes, gloves) showed no benefit.
population_specificity: Patients receiving intravitreal injections (specific demographics not detailed).
effective_dosage: Not specified (application to ocular surface mentioned).
study_duration: Not specified (single application per injection implied).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical utility of a patient-specific contrast enhancement optimizer (p-COP) for hepatic dynamic CT by comparing iodine dose variability and enhancement outcomes between p-COP-determined and standard protocols.
results_summary: The p-COP software significantly reduced interpatient variability in aortic enhancement and achieved acceptable aortic enhancement more frequently than the standard protocol, though hepatic enhancement variability was similar between groups. The 95% confidence intervals for differences in enhancement fell within predefined equivalence margins.
population_specificity: 130 patients (74 men, 56 women; median age 65 years) undergoing hepatic dynamic CT.
effective_dosage: Not specified (p-COP-determined iodine dose vs. standard protocol).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess iodine status in pediatric intestinal failure (IF) patients receiving home parenteral nutrition (HPN) compared to healthy children and evaluate whether current ESPGHAN recommendations for iodine in parenteral nutrition are adequate.
results_summary: The study found that pediatric IF patients had insufficient iodine status (median UIC 89 μg/L) despite receiving more than twice the ESPGHAN-recommended iodine dose via parenteral nutrition. Healthy children had sufficient iodine status (median UIC 133 μg/L), and iodine status in IF patients correlated with enteral provision.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients (ages 2-18) with intestinal failure receiving HPN and a reference group of healthy children.
effective_dosage: Median parenteral iodine supply was more than twice the ESPGHAN recommendation (exact dosage not specified).
study_duration: Observational cross-sectional study conducted from January to September 2017 (no intervention duration specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of adjuvant transarterial injection of radioactive iodine (27·75 MBq/kg) after curative-intent resection of hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) expressing CD147.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results regarding the efficacy or safety of the iodine treatment, only stating that 156 patients were randomly assigned to receive the intervention.
population_specificity: Patients aged 18-75 years who underwent curative-intent resection of histologically confirmed HCC expressing CD147.

study_goal: To compare the effectiveness of universal and targeted iodine supplementation strategies in preventing iodine deficiency among pregnant women.
results_summary: Both universal and targeted iodine supplementation strategies were similarly effective in preventing iodine deficiency, but targeted supplementation was better at avoiding over-supplementation. The control group had a significantly higher proportion of participants with iodine levels above the requirement compared to the study group.
population_specificity: Low-risk Thai pregnant women
study_duration: From start of treatment until delivery

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the effectiveness and safety of povidone-iodine in treating oral wounds by comparing it with chlorhexidine.
results_summary: Povidone-iodine was found effective in controlling local infections in a concentration-dependent manner, positively influencing tissue repair with low systemic toxicity and minimal bacterial resistance.
population_specificity: Patients with oral ulcerated lesions or wounds.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze factors influencing relapse in Graves' disease patients treated with antithyroid drugs (ATDs) and explore methods to reduce relapse rates.
results_summary: The study found that younger age, larger thyroid volume, higher free triiodothyronine and thyroxine levels were associated with higher relapse rates, while the block-replace ATD regimen showed lower relapse rates than the titration regimen.
population_specificity: Patients newly diagnosed with Graves' disease, aged >16 years, treated with ATDs.
study_duration: Follow-up of at least 12 months after ATD withdrawal

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if topical povidone iodine inhibits bacterial growth and disrupts the balance of the oral microbiota in mechanically ventilated patients.
results_summary: Povidone iodine significantly reduced bacterial concentration compared to the control group at 1, 2, and 3 hours post-application, without disrupting the oral microbiota balance. The intervention group showed inhibited growth of all tested bacterial species at 3 hours.
population_specificity: Mechanically ventilated patients in the intensive care unit.
effective_dosage: 10% povidone iodine applied topically to the oral cavity.
study_duration: Single application with follow-up measurements up to 3 hours.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the clinical applications of dual-energy CT, particularly its ability to differentiate iodine from hemorrhage and quantify iodine for diagnostic and prognostic purposes in neurological conditions.
results_summary: The study found that dual-energy CT can help differentiate iodine from hemorrhage, aiding in post-thrombectomy management and tumor diagnosis. Iodine quantification may also predict hematoma expansion in aneurysmal bleeds and outcomes in traumatic brain injury.
population_specificity: Patients with acute neurological presentations, including those with hemorrhage, tumors, or traumatic brain injury.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of low voltage and low concentration contrast agent on image quality, radiation dose, and iodine intake in coronary CT angiography.
results_summary: The study assessed image quality, radiation dose, and iodine intake but did not explicitly report specific outcomes related to iodine's effects.
population_specificity: 121 patients with a body mass index (BMI) <26 kg/m².

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify preoperative ultrasound and cytological differences between NIFTP and papillary thyroid carcinoma (PTC) to guide diagnosis and surgical treatment.
results_summary: NIFTP nodules were more often isoechoic with smooth borders and lower TI-RADS scores compared to non-NIFTP PTC. Cytologically, NIFTPs were mainly classified as indeterminate under the Bethesda System, with nuclear pseudo-inclusions significantly associated with non-NIFTP.
population_specificity: 81 patients who underwent thyroidectomy with histologic diagnosis of PTC, NIFTP, or invasive follicular variant of PTC (IFVPTC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the use of iodine in BODIPY-based photosensitizers for enhancing singlet oxygen generation in photodynamic therapy.
results_summary: The study found that incorporating iodine into the BODIPY scaffold improved its efficiency as a photosensitizer for singlet oxygen generation, though the abstract does not quantify the extent of this improvement. Heavy atom incorporation, including iodine, was one of several strategies explored to optimize photophysical properties.
population_specificity: Not specified (laboratory/chemical study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review current systemic therapy options and emerging molecularly targeted strategies for managing radioactive iodine-refractory thyroid cancer.
results_summary: The study highlights that tyrosine kinase inhibitors (TKIs) have improved the management of radioiodine-refractory disease, delaying progression of metastatic disease, and discusses ongoing development of more selective targeted inhibitors and novel approaches like immunotherapy.
population_specificity: Patients with radioactive iodine-refractory thyroid cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess whether omitting prophylactic prehydration prior to iodine-based contrast media administration in patients with stage 3 chronic kidney disease (CKD) was safe and noninferior to standard prehydration.
results_summary: The study found that withholding prehydration did not compromise patient safety, with no significant difference in serum creatinine levels or incidence of postcontrast acute kidney injury between the no prehydration and prehydration groups. No patients required dialysis or developed acute heart failure, and prehydration was associated with higher costs without added benefit.
population_specificity: Patients with stage 3 CKD undergoing elective contrast-enhanced computed tomography.
effective_dosage: 250 mL of 1.4% sodium bicarbonate administered in a 1-hour infusion (prehydration group).
study_duration: Single administration prior to contrast-enhanced computed tomography.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the performance of piston-based injection systems with peristaltic-based injectors in delivering iodine contrast media, focusing on achievable injection delivery rates (IDRs) and peak vascular enhancement.
results_summary: Piston-based injection systems combined with low-viscosity contrast media achieved higher IDRs and peak vascular enhancement than peristaltic-based injectors. Centargo, a piston-based system, provided superior peak vascular enhancement due to improved bolus shape.
population_specificity: Not specified (study focused on injector systems and contrast media performance).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the nephrotoxic effects of Iodixanol and Iopamidol, specifically looking for clinical and subclinical contrast-induced acute kidney injury (CI-AKI and SCI-AKI) in patients with normal kidney function.
results_summary: The study found no cases of CI-AKI but identified SCI-AKI in 13 patients, with Iopamidol showing a higher risk (OR 4.5) compared to Iodixanol. Biomarkers NGAL and [TIMP-2] × [IGFBP7] correlated positively, suggesting subclinical kidney injury.
population_specificity: Patients with an estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) ≥60 mL/min/1.73 m² undergoing intra-arterial contrast administration.
study_duration: Urinary and blood samples were collected at 4-8 h and 24-48 h post-exposure, respectively.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether myopathy during hyperthyroidism treatment is caused by rapid thyroid hormone reduction (relative hypothyroidism) rather than the treatments themselves (antithyroid drugs or radio-iodine).
results_summary: The study found that myopathy symptoms (fatigue, myalgia, elevated CK) occurred after rapid thyroid hormone correction, not directly from treatments. Symptoms resolved with thyroid hormone adjustment (discontinuing methimazole or adding levothyroxine).
population_specificity: A 25-year-old female with Grave hyperthyroidism.
effective_dosage: Not specified (methimazole and radio-iodine doses not detailed).
study_duration: 7 weeks post-methimazole; timing post-radio-iodine not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether antimicrobial (iodinated) drapes reduce intraoperative microbial contamination in patients undergoing primary knee arthroplasty and whether other factors influence contamination risk.
results_summary: The use of iodinated drapes reduced contamination risk by 35%, with contamination detected in 10% of procedures using the drapes compared to 15% without. Female sex and surgery in the central region were associated with lower contamination odds, while drape loosening increased contamination risk.
population_specificity: Patients older than 18 years undergoing primary knee arthroplasty, excluding those with iodine allergy, prior open knee surgery, septic arthritis, recent antibiotic use, or inability to understand study implications.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the feasibility and clinical application of double low-dose CT pulmonary angiography (CTPA) using reduced iodine contrast medium for diagnosing pulmonary embolism.
results_summary: Low-dose CTPA achieved significant reductions in radiation (29.6% to 87.5%) and contrast medium doses (25% to 67%) without compromising diagnostic image quality, with subjective assessments indicating similar or improved image quality compared to standard protocols.
population_specificity: Patients with suspected pulmonary embolism.
effective_dosage: Low contrast medium volume (20 to 75 ml) compared to standard (50 to 101 ml).

study_goal: The researchers were evaluating the safety and efficacy of conventional arteriography (which uses iodine-containing contrast agents) compared to newer imaging modalities for assessing vascular injuries in knee dislocation patients.
results_summary: The study found that conventional arteriography has a complication rate as high as 9% and causes more patient discomfort compared to newer imaging modalities like CT angiography and MR angiography. It also noted cost savings with selective arteriography.
population_specificity: Patients with knee dislocations, typically from high-energy impact injuries (e.g., automobile accidents, contact sports).

study_goal: The researchers sought to determine whether additional topical proparacaine improved patient experience during intravitreal injections without compromising the antiseptic efficacy of povidone iodine.
results_summary: The study found that proparacaine had some antiseptic properties but was inferior to povidone iodine. Patient perception of the injection experience did not significantly differ with or without additional proparacaine drops.
population_specificity: 36 patients undergoing intravitreal injections.
effective_dosage: One drop of povidone iodine (concentration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the association between maternal iodine levels and infant thyroid function, as well as explore opportunities and barriers to newborn screening for congenital hypothyroidism in Ghana.
results_summary: The study found a weakly positive correlation between maternal iodine levels and infant thyroid function, with nearly 30% of women showing iodine deficiency. Mothers with formal education had higher iodine levels than those without.
population_specificity: 250 women and their neonates from post-natal clinics in Accra and Tamale, Ghana.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the evolving role of radioactive iodine (RAI) therapy in the management of differentiated thyroid carcinoma, focusing on its benefits, risks, and the rationale for selective adjuvant use.
results_summary: The study highlights a shift toward personalized risk-based approaches for RAI therapy in thyroid carcinoma, acknowledging its potential benefits in primary and recurrent settings but also noting side-effects and limitations in evidence. It emphasizes the need for careful consideration of pros and cons in treatment selection.
population_specificity: Patients with differentiated thyroid carcinoma, both pre-operative and post-operative.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the clinical effectiveness and cost-effectiveness of lenvatinib and sorafenib in treating radioactive iodine-refractory differentiated thyroid cancer (RR-DTC).
results_summary: Lenvatinib and sorafenib improved median progression-free survival compared to placebo (18.3 vs. 3.6 months and 10.8 vs. 5.8 months, respectively), but both drugs increased adverse events and required dose reductions. The cost-effectiveness analysis showed ICERs above £50,000 per QALY gained for both treatments.
population_specificity: Patients with radioactive iodine-refractory differentiated thyroid cancer (RR-DTC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of early market introduction of iodized salt on iodine status, child growth, and mental development in young children.
results_summary: The intervention group showed reduced iodine deficiency in mothers and children, higher cognitive scores (4 IQ points), and improved child stimulation, but no significant differences in growth indicators.
population_specificity: Pregnant women and their children (2-13 months old) in 22 districts of Ethiopia.
effective_dosage: Not specified (iodized salt intake measured but not quantified).
study_duration: From conception until children were 2-13 months old.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether cleaning the distal urethra with povidone-iodine solution reduces post-procedural UTIs in males undergoing office cystoscopy.
results_summary: The study found that additional cleaning of the distal urethra with povidone-iodine significantly reduced UTI incidence (7% in the intervention group vs. 22% in controls). Urethral swab cultures identified prevalent microflora, supporting the role of intra-urethral bacteria in post-procedural UTIs.
population_specificity: Males undergoing office cystoscopy

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of iodine as a topical agent against chronic wound biofilms, comparing its performance to other commercially available agents.
results_summary: Iodine demonstrated the highest mean log10 reductions (4.81, ±3.14) among all tested agents in vitro, indicating strong efficacy against biofilms. However, human in vivo evidence was insufficient to definitively recommend iodine over other agents.
population_specificity: In vitro, animal models, and limited human in vivo studies focusing on chronic wound infections with confirmed biofilms.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of topical antiseptics (including povidone-iodine) versus topical or systemic antibiotics in treating chronic suppurative otitis media (CSOM).
results_summary: The study found uncertain differences in resolution of ear discharge between povidone-iodine and quinolones at one to two weeks, with no reported differences in hearing or ototoxicity. Evidence was of very low certainty.
population_specificity: Patients (adults and children) with chronic ear discharge or CSOM lasting more than two weeks.
study_duration: Follow-up periods ranged from one week to one month.

study_goal: The researchers compared the therapeutic efficacy of minocycline hydrochloride ointment versus 10% iodine in treating early peri-implantitis.
results_summary: The study found that minocycline hydrochloride ointment was significantly more effective than 10% iodine in improving plaque index, probing depth, and sulcus bleeding index in early peri-implantitis patients.
population_specificity: 180 patients with early peri-implantitis treated at a hospital.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of multikinase inhibitors (MKIs) in treating advanced refractory thyroid cancers, particularly those resistant to conventional radioactive iodine (RAI) therapy.
results_summary: The study found that MKIs showed promising progression-free survival rates compared to placebo and earlier trials, though adverse effects were substantial and nearly universal among treated patients. The severity of adverse effects appeared correlated with higher efficacy of the MKIs.
population_specificity: Patients with advanced refractory thyroid cancers resistant to surgery and RAI therapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the historical development and current status of targeted radionuclide therapy (TRT) using radioisotopes of iodine, particularly its therapeutic effects on thyroid hyperfunction and differentiated thyroid carcinoma.
results_summary: The study found that radioiodine effectively controlled thyroid hyperfunction and demonstrated antitumor effects in patients with differentiated thyroid carcinoma, extending the concept of targeted therapy to other diseases.
population_specificity: Patients with thyroid hyperfunction and differentiated thyroid carcinoma.

study_goal: To evaluate the accuracy of virtual non-contrast (VNC) images derived from arterial and venous phase spectral-detector CT (SDCT) scans compared to true-unenhanced (TNC) images for assessing liver parenchyma and vessels.
results_summary: VNC images from arterial and venous phases were very similar to TNC images, showing negligible differences in attenuation, image noise, and diagnostic utility, though inadequate iodine subtraction occurred in hepatic arteries during the arterial phase.
population_specificity: 25 patients undergoing triphasic SDCT examinations.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to establish reference intervals for serum iodine (SI), urinary iodine (UI), and the UI to urinary creatinine ratio (UI/U-Cre) in healthy Chinese adults.
results_summary: The study found that seafood intake frequency positively correlated with SI but not with UI or UI/U-Cre. SI was positively correlated with thyroid hormones (TT4, TT3, FT4). Reference intervals for SI, UI, and UI/U-Cre were established as 36.0-79.3 μg/L, 19-385 μg/L, and 22-450 μg/g, respectively.
population_specificity: 894 healthy Chinese adults from six cities (Beijing, Dongying, Guiyang, Urumqi, Shenzhen, and Qiqihar).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of vacuum-assisted closure (VAC) dressing versus traditional wound dressing (using povidone iodine) in wound healing for open fractures.
results_summary: The study found that VAC dressing significantly improved wound healing compared to traditional dressing, with better granulation tissue appearance, reduced wound surface area, and shorter hospital stays.
population_specificity: Patients with open fractures requiring wound management.
effective_dosage: Traditional dressing involved sequential use of hydrogen peroxide, normal saline, and povidone iodine (specific dosage not detailed).
study_duration: Dressings were changed daily for traditional group and every 3-4 days for VAC group (total duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review epidemiological, clinical, and experimental data on the neuroendocrine effects of prenatal exposure to radioactive iodine (131I), particularly in the context of nuclear reactor accidents.
results_summary: The study found that prenatal exposure to 131I is associated with reduced head and chest circumference at birth, increased risk of goiter with large thyroid nodules, and possibly thyroid cancer. Data on brain damage were inconclusive, but cognitive and behavioral disorders were noted, along with increased incidence of non-cancerous endocrine disorders and retinal vascular degeneration.
population_specificity: Prenatally exposed individuals (human and Wistar rat models), particularly those affected by the Chornobyl disaster.
effective_dosage: Not specified (doses estimated based on ICRP Publication 88).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of lenvatinib and sorafenib in treating radioactive iodine-refractory differentiated thyroid cancer (RR-DTC).
results_summary: Lenvatinib and sorafenib showed improvements in progression-free survival and tumor response rates compared to placebo, but overall survival data were confounded by high treatment crossover. Adverse events were more common with these drugs than placebo, but the specific side effects differed between them.
population_specificity: Patients with progressive, locally advanced or metastatic, radioactive iodine-refractory differentiated thyroid cancer (RR-DTC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of talc seromadesis (not iodine) for managing chronic seromas after incisional hernia surgery.
results_summary: The study found that talc seromadesis was ineffective, with a high recurrence rate of seromas. In two cases, recurrence was managed with instillation of ethanol and iodine povidone, but the abstract does not detail iodine's specific efficacy.
population_specificity: Patients diagnosed with chronic seromas after incisional hernia surgery.
study_duration: Follow-up was at least 4 weeks after drainage removal.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of topical insulin versus conventional Pyodine (iodine-based) dressing in healing diabetic foot ulcers.
results_summary: The study found that topical insulin resulted in significantly greater wound contraction (49.7% reduction) compared to the placebo group (19.2% reduction), with statistically significant differences in post-treatment wound diameter and healing rates.
population_specificity: 110 diabetic patients with foot ulcers, mean age 53.23 ± 6.21 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how different response criteria and follow-up protocols affect the evaluation of radioactive iodine (RAI) therapy's clinical usefulness in patients with differentiated thyroid carcinoma (DTC).
results_summary: The study found that adding a radioiodine scan to follow-up protocols significantly reduced the proportion of patients classified as having an excellent response. High administered RAI activity (3.7 GBq or higher) consistently predicted favorable responses regardless of the follow-up protocol or response classification.
population_specificity: 1563 patients with DTC who underwent first RAI therapy after total or near-total thyroidectomy.
effective_dosage: Low (1.11 GBq) or high (3.7 GBq or higher) administered RAI activity.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to describe the role of iodine in Hashimoto's thyroiditis (HT) and its association with autoimmune thyroid disorders (AITDs).
results_summary: The abstract highlights that HT is the leading cause of hypothyroidism in iodine-sufficient areas, with immune-pathogenesis involving chemokines and cytokines. It also notes the association between AITDs and other autoimmune disorders or papillary thyroid cancer.
population_specificity: Patients with Hashimoto's thyroiditis and autoimmune thyroid disorders.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare dual-energy spectral computed tomography (DESCT) characteristics in lung adenocarcinoma patients with KRAS and EGFR mutations, including iodine-related parameters like normalized iodine concentration (NIC).
results_summary: The study found that DESCT parameters, including NIC, differed significantly between KRAS and EGFR mutation groups in solid lung adenocarcinoma nodules, suggesting DESCT could help differentiate these mutations.
population_specificity: 72 patients with surgically resected lung adenocarcinoma (12 with KRAS mutations, 60 with EGFR mutations).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of MRI and 18F FDG PET-CT in detecting recurrence or metastases in postoperative DTC patients with elevated Tg levels but negative 131I-WBS results.
results_summary: MRI showed moderate accuracy (79.5%) in detecting lesions, while 18F FDG PET-CT demonstrated higher accuracy (93.1%). MRI could serve as an adjunct but was inadequate for detecting small lymph node metastases.
population_specificity: 32 postoperative patients with DTC (26 papillary, 6 follicular thyroid carcinoma).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the diagnostic performance of late iodine enhancement CT (LIE-CT) in characterizing scarred myocardium, comparing it to late gadolinium enhancement MRI (LGE-MRI) as a reference, while evaluating the impact of reader experience and scar pattern.
results_summary: LIE-CT showed strong correlation with LGE-MRI for scar detection, particularly with experienced readers, but sensitivity was lower for small non-ischemic scars. The most experienced reader had higher accuracy (95% vs. 88%) and sensitivity (93% vs. 83%) compared to the less experienced reader.
population_specificity: 40 consecutive patients with suspected or known myocardial scarring.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the safety and efficacy of vitamin C solution (VCS) for relieving adverse symptoms caused by Lugol iodine staining during chromoendoscopy.
results_summary: VCS and sodium thiosulfate solution (STS) both reduced acute and late adverse symptom severity scores compared to normal saline, with VCS showing better relief for specific symptoms like acid regurgitation and retrosternal discomfort. VCS also quickly discolored iodine-stained mucosa, similar to STS.
population_specificity: 240 patients undergoing Lugol chromoendoscopy for esophageal dysplasia and carcinoma visualization.
effective_dosage: 20 mL of 2% VCS or 5% STS after spraying 10 mL of 2% Lugol iodine solution.
study_duration: Not specified (acute and late symptom assessments).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness and safety of 18 mm vs. 20 mm iodine seed-loaded stents for dysphagia relief in esophageal cancer patients.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in dysphagia relief between the two stent sizes, but the 18 mm stent resulted in significantly less severe retrosternal pain and a trend toward longer survival.
population_specificity: Esophageal cancer patients in China (n=157).
study_duration: Median survival was 176 days for the 18 mm group and 109 days for the 20 mm group.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of a new povidone-iodine (PVP-I) foam dressing versus a standard foam dressing for managing diabetic foot ulcers.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in wound healing, infection rates, or patient satisfaction between the PVP-I foam dressing and the standard foam dressing. Adverse events were comparable between groups, with no causal relationship to the dressings.
population_specificity: 71 patients aged ≥19 years with type 1/2 diabetes and early-phase diabetic foot ulcers (Wagner classification grade 1/2).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of radioactive iodine in treating thyrotoxicosis-induced cholestasis in a patient with hyperthyroidism.
results_summary: Radioactive iodine significantly relieved hyperthyroidism but initially worsened cholestasis, which later improved with additional steroid treatment. Liver function normalized within 3 months.
population_specificity: A single patient with hyperthyroidism and severe cholestasis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess regional differences in T1 papillary thyroid cancer outcomes (including treatment approaches and recurrence rates) among patients in South Korea, Turkey, and Colombia.
results_summary: The study found significant differences in recurrence rates (higher in Colombia), disease presentation, and treatment approaches (e.g., radioactive iodine treatment, tumor characteristics) among the three countries, with no reported mortality.
population_specificity: 2720 patients (80% female, mean age 45.2 years) with T1 papillary thyroid cancer from South Korea, Turkey, and Colombia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of povidone-iodine and chlorhexidine alcohol solutions in preventing surgical site infections (SSIs) in gynecologic surgeries for malignant and premalignant conditions, and to evaluate the impact of temperature on efficacy.
results_summary: Warming povidone-iodine significantly reduced SSI rates compared to non-warmed povidone-iodine, but no significant difference was found between povidone-iodine and chlorhexidine alcohol groups overall. Enterococcus faecalis was the most common causative organism in SSIs.
population_specificity: 220 patients undergoing surgery for malignant or premalignant gynecologic conditions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of iodine-NaF application in mothers' dentition for preventing early childhood caries (ECC) in their children.
results_summary: The study found uncertain evidence regarding the difference in caries presence in primary teeth between antimicrobial (including iodine-NaF) and placebo treatments in mothers' dentition (RR 0.97, 95% CI 0.80 to 1.19; very low-certainty evidence). No significant conclusions could be drawn due to the low certainty of evidence.
population_specificity: Pregnant women, new mothers, or primary caregivers of infants in the first year of life, including socioeconomically disadvantaged groups.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a deep learning method for generating virtual noncontrast CT images from contrast-enhanced CT images without requiring a dual-energy CT scanner.
results_summary: The DL-based method improved prediction accuracy of CT numbers in bone regions compared to the DECT approach, achieving rapid generation of VNC images with greater agreement to true noncontrast images.
population_specificity: 61 patients who underwent head and neck radiotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the impact of thyroid diseases, particularly hyperthyroidism and hypothyroidism, on reproductive health from birth onward.
results_summary: The study found that hyperthyroidism and hypothyroidism affect reproductive health differently in males and females, with impacts on semen quality, sexual behavior, menstrual irregularities, and fertility. Early treatment of congenital hypothyroidism allows for normal development.
population_specificity: Children and adults with thyroid disorders, including congenital hypothyroidism and Graves' disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of a single application and twice-daily treatment of 10% povidone iodine in reducing nasal methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) colonization.
results_summary: A single application of 10% povidone iodine significantly reduced nasal MRSA at 1 and 6 hours but not at 12 or 24 hours. Twice-daily treatment for 5 days did not reduce MRSA colonization 12 hours postdosing compared to controls.
population_specificity: Individuals with nasal MRSA colonization (specific demographics not detailed).
effective_dosage: 10% povidone iodine, single application or twice daily.
study_duration: Single application or 5 days of twice-daily treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether polymer-based encapsulation could improve the stability and absorption of iodine and other micronutrients during cooking and storage.
results_summary: Encapsulation improved iodine's stability against heat, light, moisture, and oxidation, and rodent studies confirmed rapid release and intestinal absorption, though human bioavailability data for iodine specifically was not detailed.
population_specificity: Rodents and humans (initial and follow-up studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the treatment-related toxicity and effectiveness of hemi-gland low-dose-rate prostate brachytherapy (using Iodine) for unilateral localized prostate cancer compared to whole-gland treatment.
results_summary: The study found that hemi-gland implants showed similar toxicity and biochemical outcomes to whole-gland treatment, with reduced impact on pre-treatment symptom status and earlier return to baseline urinary scores. Sexual potency was conserved in both groups, and treatment relapse rates were low (3% in both).
population_specificity: Patients with unilateral localized prostate cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the impact of thyroid hormone deficiencies, including iodine deficiency, on pregnancy outcomes and the need for timely diagnosis and treatment.
results_summary: The study found that iodine deficiency is the most common cause of hypothyroidism worldwide, but autoimmune thyroiditis is more prevalent in iodine-sufficient regions. Timely treatment of thyroid hormone deficiencies can reduce adverse pregnancy outcomes, but there is no consensus on diagnostic reference levels or universal screening.
population_specificity: Pregnant women, with specific focus on those with thyroid hormone deficiencies.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the 10-year oncologic outcomes of radical prostatectomy, external beam radiation therapy, and brachytherapy using Iodine-125 for intermediate-risk prostate cancer patients.
results_summary: Brachytherapy with Iodine-125 showed superior 10-year freedom from biochemical failure (80.2%) compared to radical prostatectomy (57.1%) and external beam radiation therapy (57.0%), with no significant differences in metastases-free or prostate cancer-specific survival.
population_specificity: 1503 intermediate-risk prostate cancer patients treated between 2004 and 2007.
study_duration: Median follow-up was 9.8 years for brachytherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of iodine-coated implants in preventing and treating postoperative infections in orthopedic surgery patients.
results_summary: The study found that iodine-coated implants had a 91% survival rate, a low reinfection rate (4.2%), and no adverse effects on thyroid function. CRP levels normalized within 4 weeks post-surgery, indicating effective infection control.
population_specificity: 72 postoperative infected patients (38 males, 34 females; mean age 59.3 years) with infections following various orthopedic procedures.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of high-specific-activity iodine as a systemic therapeutic option for metastatic pheochromocytomas and paragangliomas (MPPGs).
results_summary: The study suggests that high-specific-activity iodine, among other targeted therapies, may improve outcomes for patients with advanced and progressive MPPGs, as evidenced by its recent approval in the United States.
population_specificity: Patients with metastatic pheochromocytomas and paragangliomas (MPPGs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to understand the structural and functional aspects of deiodinases, enzymes that regulate thyroid hormone concentrations by removing iodine atoms from iodothyronines.
results_summary: The study revealed that deiodinases evolved from the ancient peroxiredoxin structure and utilize selenocysteine for their catalytic function, but key questions about substrate binding, mechanism, and regulation remain unresolved.
population_specificity: Not specified (focus on molecular and structural biology of deiodinases).

study_goal: The researchers were examining the limitations of standard iodine-based treatments (surgery and radioactive iodine) for aggressive thyroid cancers and exploring alternative therapies.
results_summary: The study identified that radioactive iodine is insufficient or inappropriate for aggressive thyroid cancers, including iodine-refractory differentiated thyroid carcinoma, anaplastic thyroid carcinoma, and progressive medullary thyroid carcinoma, and highlighted emerging treatments like kinase inhibitors.
population_specificity: Patients with aggressive thyroid cancers (radioactive iodine-refractory differentiated thyroid carcinoma, anaplastic thyroid carcinoma, and progressive medullary thyroid carcinoma).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of iodine supplementation (225 µg/day) during pregnancy in areas with mild-to-moderate iodine deficiency, focusing on thyroid function parameters and urinary iodine levels.
results_summary: Iodine supplementation significantly increased urinary iodine-to-creatinine ratios in pregnant women and reduced thyroglobulin levels, indicating improved iodine intake. No harmful effects on pregnancy or thyroid function were observed.
population_specificity: Pregnant women before 12 weeks of gestation in areas with mild-to-moderate iodine deficiency.
study_duration: From enrollment (before 12 weeks of gestation) until 8 weeks after delivery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of radioactive iodine (RAI) in the treatment of differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC) and explore alternative therapies for specific patient subsets.
results_summary: The study highlights RAI as a primary treatment modality for DTC, with active surveillance suggested for low-risk patients and novel therapies considered for progressive metastatic cases.
population_specificity: Patients with differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC), including those with low-risk disease or progressive distant metastases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the diagnostic value, sensitivity, and specificity of various radiation diagnostic methods, including scintigraphy with iodine radiopharmaceuticals, for identifying causes and variants of primary hyperaldosteronism.
results_summary: The study evaluated the diagnostic performance of iodine-based scintigraphy among other imaging techniques for primary hyperaldosteronism, noting challenges like false-positive and false-negative evaluations but highlighting their role in guiding treatment decisions.
population_specificity: Patients with primary hyperaldosteronism undergoing diagnostic evaluation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare patient discomfort (pain and heartburn) between 1% and 2% iodine solutions during esophageal chromoendoscopy and evaluate their safety, detection yield, and color evaluation.
results_summary: The 1% iodine solution caused significantly less heartburn and retrosternal pain than the 2% solution, with no difference in detection yield or color evaluation. No adverse events were reported, and both concentrations were deemed safe.
population_specificity: 77 high-risk patients scheduled for esophageal carcinoma screening via EGD.
effective_dosage: 1% and 2% iodine solutions (single application during chromoendoscopy).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify and describe case-identification algorithms for thyroid disorders (including iodine-related conditions) using Italian Healthcare Administrative Databases.
results_summary: The study found limited literature on thyroid disorders compared to diabetes, with only 9 algorithms identified for hypo- and hyperthyroidism, and no external validation performed for thyroid disorder algorithms.
population_specificity: Italian healthcare administrative data (general population, no specific demographic details provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare pathologic features and overall survival between classic and aggressive variants of papillary thyroid microcarcinoma (PMTC).
results_summary: The study found that aggressive variants (mTCV and mDSV) had more extrathyroidal extension, nodal involvement, and distant metastases compared to classic PTMC, but no difference in overall survival was observed despite more aggressive treatment.
population_specificity: Patients ≥18 years with papillary thyroid microcarcinoma (≤1 cm) from the National Cancer Data Base (2004-2015).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the diagnostic performance of CT pulmonary angiography (CTPA) using 20 ml versus 40 ml of iodine-based contrast medium (Iomeprol 400 mgI/ml) in patients with suspected pulmonary embolism.
results_summary: Both 20 ml and 40 ml protocols achieved diagnostic vascular contrast enhancement (>250 HU), though the 20 ml group showed lower mean enhancement. Image quality was sufficient but inferior in the 20 ml group, particularly in cases of massive PE or pleuro-parenchymal abnormalities.
population_specificity: Patients with clinically suspected acute pulmonary embolism.
effective_dosage: 20 ml (ultra-low volume) and 40 ml (low volume) of Iomeprol 400 mgI/ml, injected at 3 ml/s.
study_duration: Not specified (retrospective study covering October 2012 to September 2013).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the management approaches for differentiated thyroid cancer in children, including the potential use of iodine-131 radiotherapy.
results_summary: The study highlights that treatment for pediatric differentiated thyroid cancer, including iodine-131 radiotherapy, should be performed by specialists, but does not provide specific efficacy data on iodine-131.
population_specificity: Children with differentiated thyroid cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether radioactive iodine treatment (RAIT) after thyroidectomy for thyroid cancer was associated with adverse pregnancy outcomes and to determine the optimal interval between RAIT and conception.
results_summary: The study found no significant increase in adverse pregnancy outcomes (abortion, preterm delivery, congenital malformation) when conception occurred 6 months or more after RAIT. However, conceptions within 0-5 months after RAIT showed a higher risk of congenital malformation (adjusted odds ratio 1.74).
population_specificity: South Korean women of childbearing age (20-49 years) who underwent thyroidectomy for differentiated thyroid carcinoma.
study_duration: Data collected from 2008 to 2017, with follow-up varying by participant.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the utility of cone beam computed tomography (CBCT) for technical evaluation of endovascular aneurysm repair (EVAR) procedures, including the analysis of iodine contrast agent usage.
results_summary: The study found that CBCT detected positive findings requiring immediate revisions in nearly 20% of patients, with higher detection rates for endoleaks compared to DSA or CTA. Radiation exposure and iodine contrast agent usage were significantly higher for fenestrated-branched EVARs.
population_specificity: 154 patients (126 male; mean age 74 ± 8 years) undergoing standard or complex EVAR procedures.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review current treatment strategies for radioiodine-refractory thyroid cancer and explore novel approaches to restore iodine responsiveness in thyroid cancer cells.
results_summary: The study summarizes clinical trial findings and real-life experiences with multikinase inhibitors, highlighting limited survival benefits and severe adverse events. It also discusses preclinical models and new compounds targeting molecular pathways to induce redifferentiation of thyroid cancer cells.
population_specificity: Patients with radioiodine-refractory thyroid cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of povidone-iodine (PVP-I) and chlorhexidine (CHX) in reducing postoperative wound complications after trauma surgery on the lower leg and foot.
results_summary: PVP-I was associated with significantly higher rates of wound healing disorders (12.6%) and surgical site infections compared to CHX (4.5%). The odds of complications were 3.5 times higher with PVP-I than CHX.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing aseptic trauma surgery on the lower leg and foot.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of iodine deficiency during pregnancy on fetal brain development and propose better measurement methods for gestational iodine deficiency.
results_summary: The study highlights that insufficient iodine intake during pregnancy can lead to irreversible brain damage in offspring, ranging from severe neurological cretinism to subtle cognitive deficits. It calls for improved definitions and measurements of gestational iodine deficiency and further research on iodine supplementation's timing, safety, and efficacy.
population_specificity: Pregnant and lactating women, with a focus on fetal and infant neurodevelopment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety, efficacy, and advantages of povidone-iodine for preventing infection and capsular contraction in breast augmentation procedures.
results_summary: The study found povidone-iodine to be highly effective due to its broad antimicrobial spectrum, efficacy against biofilms, lack of resistance, and excellent safety profile. It demonstrated bactericidal activity against multi-drug resistant organisms, fungi, protozoa, spores, and viruses, with no reported resistance.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing breast augmentation procedures.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the best predictor of cardiac events using 123I-mIBG imaging and changes in left ventricular ejection fraction.
results_summary: The study found that 123I-mIBG planar global washout (>30%) combined with a decline in left ventricular ejection fraction (>10%) was the best indicator for cardiac event risk, with high sensitivity (100%) but moderate specificity (50%).
population_specificity: 22 patients with clinical data including electrocardiogram, echocardiography, coronary angiogram, and genetic/biomarker analysis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the identification rate and detection of residual axillary disease using radioactive iodine seed marking (MLNs) combined with sentinel lymph node biopsy (SLNs) in clinically node-positive breast cancer patients after neoadjuvant systemic therapy.
results_summary: The combination of MLN and SLN excision achieved a 99.3% identification rate and detected residual axillary disease in 63.3% of patients, outperforming either method alone (MLN: 92.8%, SLN: 87.8%). Residual disease was found in MLNs alone (23%), SLNs alone (11%), or both (66%).
population_specificity: Patients with clinically node-positive breast cancer undergoing neoadjuvant systemic therapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of a new protocol using 1% povidone-iodine (PVP-I) irrigation for preventing postoperative deep surgical site infections (SSI) following spinal surgery.
results_summary: The study found that 90 seconds of 1% PVP-I pooling every 1.5 hours followed by saline irrigation significantly reduced deep SSI rates (0% in the study group vs. 2.7% in the control group, P=0.027), though overall SSI rates did not differ significantly (1.7% vs. 3.4%, P=0.32). No adverse events were reported in the PVP-I group.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing spinal surgery at a single hospital between October 2011 and September 2016, excluding those with PVP-I allergy, prior surgical debridement for infection, or implant removal surgery.
effective_dosage: 1% PVP-I pooled for 90 seconds every 1.5 hours, followed by saline irrigation.
study_duration: The intervention was administered perioperatively, with follow-up duration not specified in the abstract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the antimicrobial efficacy and cytotoxicity of povidone-iodine irrigation solution with other commonly used solutions, including those containing antibiotics.
results_summary: Povidone-iodine was effective at eradicating both S. aureus and E. coli (p < 0.001) and showed the least cytotoxicity among the efficacious solutions (5.00% ± 0.86%).
population_specificity: In vitro study using human fibroblasts, osteoblasts, and chondrocytes, as well as bacterial cultures of S. aureus and E. coli.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of radioactive iodine (RAI) therapy in treating differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC) and how dedifferentiation affects its efficacy.
results_summary: The study found that RAI therapy is effective in reducing recurrence and mortality in DTC, but dedifferentiation of cancer cells can reduce its efficacy by impairing sodium iodide symporter (NIS) functionality. Genetic alterations may further influence treatment outcomes.
population_specificity: Patients with differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether povidone-iodine (PVI) irrigation reduces postoperative intra-abdominal abscess (IAA) in children with perforated appendicitis compared to no irrigation.
results_summary: PVI irrigation showed a 12% postoperative IAA rate versus 16% in the no irrigation group, with an 89% Bayesian probability of benefit. PVI also demonstrated high probabilities of reducing ED visits, readmissions, and shortening hospital stays.
population_specificity: Children with acute perforated appendicitis.
study_duration: Intervention duration not explicitly stated; follow-up was 1 year.
