study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the methodological limitations of dosimetry in radioactive iodine therapy (RAIT) planning for metastatic differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC) and compare the clinical outcomes of empiric versus dosimetry-based approaches.
results_summary: The study highlights the lack of standardized dosimetry protocols and insufficient clinical data to conclusively determine whether a dosimetry-based approach is superior to an empiric one in RAIT for metastatic DTC, calling for further standardization and prospective studies.
population_specificity: Patients with metastatic differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify biomarkers associated with prognosis in radioactive iodine-refractory differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC) and evaluate the efficacy of sorafenib.
results_summary: Elevated baseline VEGFA and thyroglobulin were associated with poor prognosis in DTC, suggesting potential biomarkers for disease progression. The study did not directly assess iodine's effects but focused on sorafenib's efficacy in iodine-refractory cases.
population_specificity: Patients with locally recurrent or metastatic, progressive, radioactive iodine-refractory differentiated thyroid cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the molecular mechanisms of thyroid cancer development, focusing on iodine sensitivity and alternative treatments for iodine-refractory tumors.
results_summary: The study found that differentiated thyroid cancers (DTCs) are initially sensitive to radioiodine therapy but often lose this sensitivity over time, while anaplastic (ATCs) and medullary (MTCs) thyroid cancers do not respond to iodine. Several targeted drugs, including tyrosine kinase inhibitors, have been developed for iodine-refractory tumors.
population_specificity: Patients with differentiated, anaplastic, and medullary thyroid cancers.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of total thyroidectomy compared to subtotal thyroidectomy for treating Graves' disease.
results_summary: The study concluded that total thyroidectomy is the preferred surgical option for Graves' disease, with nearly 0% recurrence, predictable postoperative hypothyroidism, and low complication rates comparable to subtotal thyroidectomy when performed by experienced surgeons.
population_specificity: Patients with Graves' disease, particularly those with large goiters, suspicious/malignant thyroid nodules, or significant ophthalmopathy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether adding dilute povidone-iodine (0.02% solution) to sterile water in splash basins reduces contamination rates during total joint arthroplasty procedures.
results_summary: The study found that adding dilute povidone-iodine completely eliminated splash basin contamination (0% positive cultures in the betadine group vs. 47.9% in the sterile water group). The most common contaminants in the control group were coagulase-negative Staphylococcus, Corynebacterium, and Micrococcus.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing primary total joint arthroplasty (TJA).
effective_dosage: 0.02% povidone-iodine solution added to sterile water in splash basins.
study_duration: Duration of the surgical procedure (mean operative time varied, with positive culture cases averaging 11 minutes longer).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the benefits of virtual monoenergetic (VM) imaging derived from dual-energy CT data for improving iodine attenuation and diagnostic accuracy in vascular or oncologic abnormalities.
results_summary: The study found that lower-kiloelectron-volt VM imaging improves iodine attenuation and diagnostic accuracy, reduces beam-hardening artifacts at higher energy levels, and allows for reduced iodinated contrast material use in patients with renal impairment.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing dual-energy CT imaging, including those with renal impairment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether multivitamin/multimineral supplement (MVM) use improved iodine intake and biomarker status in older adults.
results_summary: MVM use was associated with higher iodine intake and improved iodine biomarker status compared to food alone, reducing the prevalence of inadequacies.
population_specificity: Adults aged ≥51 years

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether the absence of iodine staining during chromoendoscopy could predict the progression of esophageal lesions to severe dysplasia, carcinoma in situ, or ESCC, and to develop a risk model combining iodine staining with other patient features.
results_summary: The study found that lesions not staining with iodine but classified as non-dysplastic at baseline had a high risk of progression (39.3% in the development cohort, 50.0% in the validation cohort). A model combining iodine staining with patient features accurately identified high-risk patients (AUC 0.868-0.850).
population_specificity: 1,468 participants aged 45-69 in China, with baseline negative iodine staining or mild/moderate dysplasia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of two versus six weeks of topical Cadexomer Iodine therapy in reducing microbial load and promoting wound healing in diabetic foot ulcers with chronic biofilm infections.
results_summary: Cadexomer Iodine reduced microbial load in 78% of samples and affected microbial community composition, but treatment duration (2 vs. 6 weeks) did not significantly impact outcomes. Initial wound size reduction occurred in all ulcers, suggesting biofilm disruption.
population_specificity: Patients with non-healing diabetic foot ulcers and suspected chronic biofilm infections.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the appropriate treatment and follow-up strategies for low-risk papillary thyroid cancers, including the use of radioiodine.
results_summary: The study found that aggressive treatment is unnecessary for low-risk papillary thyroid cancers, with initial treatment typically involving total thyroidectomy or hemithyroidectomy. Post-operative radioiodine should be limited to selected cases, and follow-up can be simplified for patients showing an excellent response to treatment.
population_specificity: Patients with low-risk papillary thyroid cancers.
study_duration: Follow-up at 6-18 months, with annual monitoring thereafter.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the diagnostic value of PSV-ITA measured by CFDU in differentiating Graves' disease from thyroiditis, comparing its sensitivity and specificity to 99mTc pertechnetate thyroid scanning.
results_summary: The study found that PSV-ITA values were significantly higher in Graves' disease patients than in thyroiditis patients, with a cutoff of 30 cm/sec yielding 91% sensitivity and 89% specificity for diagnosis. The method's diagnostic performance was comparable to 99mTc pertechnetate thyroid uptake.
population_specificity: 65 patients (46 with Graves' disease and 19 with thyroiditis).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the history of levothyroxine and discuss future issues regarding the optimal treatment of hypothyroidism, including the role of iodine deficiency and autoimmune causes.
results_summary: The study highlights that iodine deficiency is the most common cause of thyroid disorders globally, but in iodine-sufficient areas, Hashimoto's disease predominates. Levothyroxine is the primary treatment, though nearly one-third of treated patients still exhibit symptoms, indicating a need for optimized dosing and potential combination therapies.
population_specificity: Adults with overt primary hypothyroidism.
effective_dosage: Starting dose of 1.6 µg/kg/day of levothyroxine, titrated to achieve optimal TSH levels (0.4-4.0 mIU/L).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of povidone iodine and chlorhexidine gluconate as pre-operative skin antiseptics for preventing surgical site infections.
results_summary: The study found that chlorhexidine alcohol solution was reported as more effective than povidone iodine for pre-operative skin antisepsis, though both are commonly used. Povidone iodine remains a standard option, but recent evidence favors chlorhexidine.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing surgical procedures (specific population not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess whether a nutrient-enriched protein substitute could improve dietary compliance and nutrient intake, including iodine, in noncompliant adults with PKU.
results_summary: The study found that baseline iodine intake was below recommendations in PKU adults, and the intervention reduced natural protein and phenylalanine intake, though specific iodine outcomes were not detailed.
population_specificity: Twelve adults with PKU (33.7 ± 2.6 years) who had been noncompliant for 1-11 years.
effective_dosage: 33 g of a low-volume, nutrient-enriched protein substitute daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of a CD45-targeted antibody-radionuclide conjugate (ARC) using iodine-131 for treating relapsed/refractory lymphoma.
results_summary: The therapy was well-tolerated with no dose-limiting toxicities, and objective responses, including complete remissions, were observed across various lymphoma histologies, with some patients remaining in remission for 35-41 months.
population_specificity: Patients with relapsed/refractory B-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma (B-NHL), Hodgkin lymphoma, and T-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma (T-NHL).
effective_dosage: Absorbed doses up to 32 Gy to the liver.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the disinfection effects of benzalkonium chloride and povidone iodine in nasotracheal intubation to determine which agent provided better sustained antimicrobial effects.
results_summary: Povidone iodine initially showed superior disinfection effects compared to benzalkonium chloride, but benzalkonium chloride maintained antimicrobial effects longer. In vitro tests also indicated benzalkonium chloride had higher inhibitory activity against Staphylococcus aureus.
population_specificity: 50 patients aged 20-70 years classified as ASA classes 1 and 2, scheduled for general anesthesia with nasotracheal intubation.
study_duration: Duration of the intervention was not explicitly stated in the abstract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the moisturizing and irritation effects of sacha inchi oil, including its iodine content, on skin.
results_summary: The study found that sacha inchi oil contained 203.00 ± 0.04 g I and was mild to the skin, benefiting dry skin. No specific results regarding iodine's effects were highlighted.
population_specificity: Subjects with dry skin (specific demographics not provided).
study_duration: 14 days of application followed by 2 days of discontinuation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the diagnostic and prognostic performance of high-sensitive thyroglobulin (ON-T4 hs-Tg) in differentiating patients with structural disease from those with no evidence of disease (SED and NED) in differentiated thyroid carcinoma (DTC).
results_summary: The study found that ON-T4 hs-Tg had a high negative predictive value (99.4%) for both diagnostic and prognostic performance, indicating it is an excellent tool to rule out structural disease in DTC patients. The results suggest that follow-up intensity and frequency can be safely reduced in patients with undetectable high-sensitive Tg.
population_specificity: Outpatients diagnosed with DTC, treated with near-total or total thyroidectomy with or without radioactive iodine (RAI).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the feasibility, safety, and clinical efficacy of CT-guided iodine treatment for secondary adrenal carcinoma.
results_summary: The study found a 90% local control rate (complete + partial response) with a median survival time of 19 months. The 1-, 2-, 3-, and 5-year overall survival rates were 83.70%, 46.8%, 20.80%, and 20.80%, respectively.
population_specificity: Twenty patients with secondary adrenal carcinoma.
study_duration: Mean follow-up time was 23.65 months (range 5-102 months).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to standardize radioactive Iodine-125 seed implantation for pancreatic cancer treatment and reduce adverse reactions and complications.
results_summary: The study established an expert consensus to improve the procedure's safety and efficacy, focusing on minimizing adverse reactions and complications during and after implantation.
population_specificity: Patients with pancreatic cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of liver resection as a treatment for iodine-negative hepatic metastases of differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC).
results_summary: The study found that liver resection was effective and safe for treating large iodine-negative hepatic metastases of DTC, with good short- and long-term outcomes in both patients. The decision for surgery should be based on the feasibility of radical and safe resection.
population_specificity: Patients with iodine-negative hepatic metastases of differentiated thyroid cancer (one 36-year-old woman with papillary thyroid cancer and one 65-year-old man with follicular thyroid cancer).
study_duration: Follow-up periods were 8 years for the first patient and 12 months for the second patient.

study_goal: To evaluate the safety and tolerability of a one-time administration of ophthalmic 5% povidone-iodine (5% PVP-I) for treating adenoviral conjunctivitis.
results_summary: The study found that 5% PVP-I was safe and well-tolerated, with no significant changes in visual acuity or participant-rated discomfort, though corneal staining increased temporarily post-administration. One adverse event was reported but deemed unrelated to treatment.
population_specificity: 56 participants with adenoviral conjunctivitis and red eye symptoms ≤4 days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess whether virtual unenhanced (VUE) images derived from Dual-Energy CT could replace true unenhanced (TUE) images for quantifying iodine-based contrast enhancement in renal CT exams.
results_summary: VUE images accurately classified nonenhancing and highly enhancing lesions but showed significantly lower enhancement measurements for intermediately enhancing lesions compared to TUE images. Sensitivity was 91.2% for positively enhancing masses but dropped to 43.2% for all iodine-present scenarios.
population_specificity: Simulated renal lesions in phantom models representing small, medium, and large patients.
effective_dosage: Varied levels of iodinated contrast mixed with a blood surrogate (specific amounts not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the accuracy, effectiveness, and tolerability of HyFoSy as an alternative to HSG for tubal patency testing, noting its lack of iodine exposure.
results_summary: HyFoSy was found to be a safe, well-tolerated, and less painful alternative to HSG, with comparable or better accuracy for tubal patency testing, though its therapeutic effect on pregnancy rates remains unclear.
population_specificity: Women undergoing evaluation for subfertility.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the role of Multi-Kinase Inhibitors (MKIs) in treating Iodine Refractory Differentiated Thyroid Carcinoma (RR-DTC) and advanced/metastatic medullary thyroid carcinoma, focusing on their side-effect profiles and recent patents.
results_summary: The study highlights differences in the safety profiles of recent drugs used for advanced thyroid cancer and discusses recent discoveries for diagnosis or treatment, emphasizing the need for risk/benefit assessments by health professionals.
population_specificity: Patients with Iodine Refractory Differentiated Thyroid Carcinoma (RR-DTC) and advanced/metastatic medullary thyroid carcinoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of thyroid hormone (related to iodine) in pregnancy and fetal development, including the implications of thyroid dysfunction and treatment.
results_summary: The study found that overt hypothyroidism during pregnancy is linked to adverse outcomes and requires treatment, while borderline thyroid dysfunction's treatment benefits remain unclear. Thyroid hormone replacement often needs dose adjustments during pregnancy, but universal screening is still debated.
population_specificity: Pregnant women, particularly those with thyroid dysfunction or on thyroid hormone replacement.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the susceptibility of different MRSA strains (livestock-associated, healthcare-associated, and community-associated) to commonly used antiseptics, including iodine (PVP-I).
results_summary: PVP-I showed the lowest activity among the tested antiseptics, with a minimal inhibitory concentration (MIC) of 1024 mg/L, indicating significantly reduced efficacy compared to other substances like OCT and PHMB. No significant differences in susceptibility were found between the MRSA strain groups.
population_specificity: Livestock-associated, healthcare-associated, and community-associated MRSA strains, as well as a reference methicillin-sensitive *Staphylococcus aureus* (MSSA) strain.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether povidone-iodine ear wash, as an adjunctive therapy to standard treatment, improves outcomes for chronic suppurative otitis media (CSOM).
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results on iodine's effects, as it describes a protocol for a future trial rather than completed findings. The study will evaluate clinical, microbiological, and hearing outcomes.
population_specificity: Children aged 2 months to 17 years, Indigenous or non-Indigenous, living in Northern Territory communities.
study_duration: 16 weeks (for oral cotrimoxazole/placebo; iodine wash duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the management of hyperthyroidism during pregnancy, including the safety and efficacy of antithyroid drugs and the role of iodine-related treatments.
results_summary: The study highlights that Graves' disease is the primary cause of clinically significant hyperthyroidism in pregnancy, with antithyroid drugs being adjusted based on risk. Radioactive iodine is contraindicated, and postpartum relapse is common.
population_specificity: Pregnant individuals with hyperthyroidism, particularly those with Graves' disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether salt double-fortified with iodine and iron (DFS) improved iron status and resolved iron deficiency in a specific population.
results_summary: Consuming DFS significantly predicted resolution of iron deficiency and low body iron compared to iodized salt alone, but it did not significantly improve hemoglobin levels or anemia resolution.
population_specificity: Female tea pluckers aged 18-55 years in West Bengal, India.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review infection types and prevention strategies, including the preoperative use of povidone-iodine, following strabismus surgery.
results_summary: The study found that infections following strabismus surgery, though rare, can be severe, particularly endophthalmitis. Preoperative use of povidone-iodine was suggested to reduce bacterial load and infection risk.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing strabismus surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of iodine-125 (125I) seeds versus metallic clips for marking nonpalpable malignant breast lesions prior to surgery.
results_summary: The study found that using 125I seeds resulted in significantly smaller surgical specimens compared to metallic clips, with no significant differences in margin involvement or reintervention rates between the two groups.
population_specificity: Patients with histologically confirmed nonpalpable malignant breast lesions treated by surgery in 2015 or 2016.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the response rate, progression-free survival, and overall survival of lenvatinib in patients with radioactive iodine-resistant differentiated thyroid cancer in a real-life setting.
results_summary: Partial response and stable disease were observed in 36% and 41% of subjects, respectively, with a median progression-free survival of 10.8 months and overall survival of 23.8 months. Common side effects included fatigue (13.6%) and hypertension (11.6%).
population_specificity: Patients with radioactive iodine-resistant differentiated thyroid cancer, many of whom had comorbidities or prior systemic treatments.
study_duration: From November 2014 to September 2016 (exact individual treatment duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare different iodine-131 activity selection strategies for treating advanced differentiated thyroid carcinoma (DTC).
results_summary: The study highlights that lesion dosimetry and maximum safe activity-based approaches are available for iodine-131 therapy in advanced DTC, with more outcome data supporting the latter. It argues for the use of dosimetry in advanced DTC cases.
population_specificity: Patients with advanced differentiated thyroid carcinoma (DTC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether parotid gland massage could prevent salivary gland damage caused by high-dose iodine therapy in thyroidectomized patients.
results_summary: The study found that parotid gland massage significantly reduced serum amylase levels and the incidence of salivary gland dysfunction, as measured by scintigraphy, compared to the non-massage group. The massage group showed better outcomes in both serological markers and long-term gland function.
population_specificity: One hundred thyroidectomized patients with differentiated thyroid cancer undergoing high-dose iodine therapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review treatment approaches for advanced differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC), including the role of radioactive iodine and molecular-targeted therapies.
results_summary: The study found that radioactive iodine is effective for most DTC cases, but advanced or iodine-refractory disease requires alternative treatments like multi-kinase inhibitors (sorafenib, lenvatinib), which improve progression-free survival but have notable side effects.
population_specificity: Patients with advanced differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC), including those with aerodigestive tract invasion, distant metastases, or radioiodine-refractory disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of the IGF axis in thyroid tumorigenesis and assess the potential of IGF-targeted combination therapies for undifferentiated thyroid carcinomas.
results_summary: The study found that differentiated thyroid carcinomas (PTC and FTC) respond to radioiodine therapy, while undifferentiated tumors (PDTC and ATC) are refractory to it. Combining IGF-signaling inhibitors with other anti-tumor drugs may be a promising strategy for aggressive thyroid tumors.
population_specificity: Patients with differentiated (PTC, FTC) and undifferentiated (PDTC, ATC) thyroid carcinomas.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of 1% iodine in 70% ethanol versus 0.5% chlorhexidine gluconate in 70% ethanol for preventing surgical site infections in elective hip or knee arthroplasty.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in superficial wound complications between iodine-alcohol and chlorhexidine-alcohol groups. However, iodine-alcohol demonstrated greater efficacy in preventing surgical site infections and prosthetic joint infections compared to chlorhexidine-alcohol.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing elective hip or knee arthroplasty.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of 1% and 2% povidone-iodine (PVP-I) topical solutions versus a vehicle-control in treating cancer therapy-associated paronychia (CAP).
results_summary: The study found that 2% PVP-I was significantly more effective than the control in reducing CAP severity, with 52.7% of affected nails meeting the primary endpoint compared to 37.9% in the control group. Additionally, pain levels decreased notably in the 2% PVP-I group over time.
population_specificity: Adult patients with cancer experiencing CAP.
effective_dosage: 1% or 2% PVP-I topical solution applied twice daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic strategy involving radioactive iodine therapy for managing thyroglossal duct carcinoma in a specific case.
results_summary: The study reported successful treatment of thyroglossal papillary duct carcinoma in a 14-year-old girl using a combination of total thyroidectomy, radioactive iodine therapy, and suppressive levothyroxine therapy. The approach was effective, but the abstract notes the lack of clear guidelines for such cases.
population_specificity: 14-year-old girl with thyroglossal papillary duct carcinoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of 2% chlorhexidine-70% isopropanol versus 5% povidone iodine-69% ethanol in reducing reoperation rates after cardiac surgery.
results_summary: The study is ongoing, so no results regarding iodine's effects are reported in the abstract.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing cardiac surgery (n=4100).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the adaptation of treatment and follow-up strategies for low-risk thyroid cancer, including the use of radioactive iodine (RAI), to optimize medical resources and patient quality of life.
results_summary: The study suggests that for low-risk thyroid cancer, treatment strategies such as surgery extent, RAI administration, and follow-up modalities should be tailored to minimize overtreatment while maintaining efficacy. The approach aims to balance medical outcomes with quality of life, particularly for patients whose prognosis mirrors the general population.
population_specificity: Patients with low-risk thyroid cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a povidone-iodine applicator was non-inferior to conventional sterilization methods in preventing wound infections during abdominal surgery.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in wound infection rates between the povidone-iodine applicator group (6.7%) and the conventional sterilization group (6.5%), demonstrating non-inferiority. The applicator method was also noted to be cheaper.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing elective abdominal surgery.
study_duration: Single sterilization at the time of surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor (VEGF) Trap (VT) in treating patients with progressive, radioactive iodine (RAI)-refractory thyroid cancer.
results_summary: The study found no complete or partial responses to VT, with 34 patients achieving stable disease and 6 experiencing progression. Only 16 patients remained stable for over 6 months, and 6 for over 12 months, indicating limited efficacy.
population_specificity: Patients with progressive, RAI-refractory thyroid cancer (24 papillary, 2 follicular, 11 Hurthle cell, and 3 poorly differentiated).
study_duration: Median duration on treatment was 4.1 months (range: 0.6-30.8 months).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Selumetinib could restore iodine uptake in radioiodine-refractory thyroid cancer patients, enabling subsequent I-131 therapy to improve progression-free survival.
results_summary: The study found that Selumetinib could potentially restore iodine uptake in refractory thyroid cancer patients, allowing I-131 therapy, with the primary objective being increased progression-free survival compared to historical controls. Toxicity and dosimetry data were also collected.
population_specificity: Patients with locally advanced or metastatic differentiated thyroid cancer and iodine-refractory disease.
effective_dosage: Four weeks of oral Selumetinib (specific dosage not mentioned).
study_duration: Four weeks of Selumetinib, followed by I-131 therapy and follow-up.

study_goal: The researchers were not directly studying iodine but comparing its litospheric concentrations to lanthanides in the context of neural function influence.
results_summary: The abstract does not report any specific findings about iodine's effects, focusing instead on lanthanides and their potential neural impacts.
population_specificity: Not specified

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of radioactive iodine (I-131) in postoperative ablation therapy for differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC) and the significance of thyroglobulin (Tg) as a tumor marker.
results_summary: The study found that radioactive iodine ablation is indicated for high-risk DTC patients, while its use in low- and intermediate-risk patients remains debated. Thyroglobulin measurement, particularly the Tg/TSH ratio and Tg doubling-time, is crucial for prognosis and long-term follow-up.
population_specificity: Patients with differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC) who underwent total thyroidectomy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate strategies, including nasal povidone-iodine, for reducing Staphylococcus aureus surgical site infections (SSIs) through nasal decolonization.
results_summary: Nasal povidone-iodine was identified as a promising intervention for reducing S. aureus SSIs, though more studies are needed to confirm its efficacy compared to established treatments like mupirocin.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing cardiac and orthopedic surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review imaging techniques for evaluating congenital hypothyroidism and discuss their benefits and limitations.
results_summary: The study found that imaging studies, including iodine-based radionuclide scanning, can help establish the etiology of congenital hypothyroidism, though they may not change immediate management in most cases. Genetic abnormalities in hormone synthesis pathways are increasingly recognized, potentially affecting treatment requirements.
population_specificity: Patients with congenital hypothyroidism, particularly those with normally located glands and mildly decreased thyroid function.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and cytotoxicity of povidone-iodine (PVI) as an antiseptic irrigation solution in preventing and managing penile prosthesis infections.
results_summary: Diluted PVI (0.35-3.5% for 3 minutes) showed potential benefits in preventing penile prosthesis infections, with evidence supporting its use in both primary implantation and salvage procedures. However, all tested antiseptic solutions, including PVI, demonstrated in vitro cytotoxic effects at subclinical concentrations.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing penile prosthesis implantation or salvage procedures for infected hardware.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of 10% povidone-iodine versus 1.5% olanexidine in preventing surgical site infections (SSIs) in clean-contaminated gastrointestinal surgeries.
results_summary: The study is a randomized controlled trial comparing povidone-iodine and olanexidine, with the primary outcome being the 30-day postoperative SSI rate. Final results were not yet published at the time of the abstract.
population_specificity: Patients aged ≥20 years undergoing clean-contaminated gastrointestinal surgeries.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of TACE plus Iodine-125 seed strand endovascular implantation (ISEI) compared to TACE alone for treating advanced hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC).
results_summary: The study found that TACE plus ISEI significantly improved 6-month and 1-year overall survival (OS) compared to TACE alone, with no major procedure-related complications reported.
population_specificity: Advanced hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) patients (1059 participants across nine studies).

study_goal: To evaluate the diagnostic accuracy of 18F-FDG-PET/CT for detecting recurrent/metastatic diseases in differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC) patients with thyroglobulin elevation and negative iodine scintigraphy, and compare TSH-stimulated vs. non-stimulated PET/CT performance.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found 18F-FDG-PET/CT had high diagnostic accuracy (sensitivity 0.86, specificity 0.84, AUC 0.91) for detecting recurrent/metastatic DTC, but with high heterogeneity and possible publication bias. No significant difference was found between TSH-stimulated and non-stimulated PET/CT.
population_specificity: Differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC) patients with thyroglobulin elevation and negative iodine scintigraphy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the diagnosis and treatment of thyroid dysfunction, including iodine intake, during pregnancy in Spanish hospitals.
results_summary: The study found that gestational hypothyroidism may be underdiagnosed or inadequately diagnosed, with only half of the centers performing universal screening and few using trimester-specific TSH reference values. Intra-gestational hypothyroidism cases had higher TSH levels and later first visits compared to pre-gestational cases.
population_specificity: Pregnant females with gestational hypothyroidism attending Spanish healthcare centers.
study_duration: Data collected from March 2013 to July 2014 (retrospective study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether radioactive iodine (RAI) remnant ablation improves thyroid cancer-related outcomes in patients with papillary thyroid microcarcinoma (PTMC) after thyroidectomy.
results_summary: The study found that RAI remnant ablation was associated with lower locoregional recurrence, distant metastasis, and thyroid cancer-related mortality rates, though the differences were not statistically significant. The authors concluded that RAI may improve outcomes for PTMC patients post-thyroidectomy.
population_specificity: Patients with papillary thyroid microcarcinoma (PTMC) treated with total or near-total thyroidectomy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare outcomes of thyroid lobectomy (TL) versus total thyroidectomy (TT) for low-risk papillary thyroid cancer (PTC) as per 2015 ATA guidelines.
results_summary: Overall survival for low-risk PTC patients was comparable between TL and TT. Locoregional recurrence after TL was under 6%, and completion thyroidectomy (CT) was needed in 34% of cases (11% when excluding specific indications).
population_specificity: Patients with low-risk papillary thyroid cancer (PTC) meeting 2015 ATA guidelines criteria.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the prevalence of thyroid dysfunction (TD) in elderly Chinese patients with type 2 diabetes (T2D) following universal salt iodization.
results_summary: The study found a high prevalence of TD (23.79%) in elderly T2D patients, with subclinical hypothyroidism being the most common subtype. Treatment goals for TD and T2D were achieved in only 39.6% and 34.41% of cases, respectively, and TD was associated with higher incidences of dyslipidemia, elevated LDL, and osteoporosis.
population_specificity: Elderly Chinese patients with type 2 diabetes (N = 1677).
study_duration: Data collected between December 2015 and July 2016 (cross-sectional study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare cure rates at 12 months among three different doses of I-131, with or without lithium carbonate, in patients with rapid turnover Graves' disease.
results_summary: The highest dose of I-131 (7.4 MBq/g) without lithium carbonate showed the highest cure rate (80%) at 12 months, with significantly better outcomes than lower doses combined with lithium carbonate. Side effects were reported in 12% of patients, with four cases likely linked to lithium carbonate.
population_specificity: Sixty Graves' disease patients with rapid iodine turnover referred for radioactive iodine treatment.
effective_dosage: Group A: 3.7 MBq I-131/g thyroid plus 600 mg/day LiCO3; Group B: 5.55 MBq I-131/g plus 600 mg/day LiCO3; Group C: 7.4 MBq I-131/g without LiCO3.
study_duration: 12 months (data collected at baseline, 3, 6, 9, and 12 months).
interactions: Lithium carbonate was noted as a potential interaction, with side effects observed in some patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the optimal extent of thyroid surgery (lobectomy vs. complete thyroidectomy) and follow-up strategies for low- and intermediate-risk differentiated thyroid carcinoma (DTC) patients.
results_summary: The study found that a conservative approach (thyroid lobectomy) may be preferable over immediate completion surgery, as recurrence rates are low and salvage surgery does not impact survival. Risk stratification systems should guide short- and long-term follow-up.
population_specificity: Patients with low- and intermediate-risk differentiated thyroid carcinoma (primary tumor <4 cm, no extrathyroidal extension or lymph node metastases).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the efficacy, pharmacokinetics, and safety of iodine-131 tositumomab (I-131 TST) combined with CHOP chemotherapy in treating previously untreated mantle-cell lymphoma (MCL).
results_summary: The study found an 84% overall unconfirmed response rate and a 44% confirmed complete response rate, with a median progression-free survival of 27.6 months. No new or unexpected safety signals were identified.
population_specificity: Patients with previously untreated mantle-cell lymphoma (MCL).
effective_dosage: Dosimetric dose: 35 mg I-131 TST (5 mCi); therapeutic dose: individualized dose of I-131 TST (65-75 cGy).
study_duration: CHOP treatment commenced approximately 13 weeks after the therapeutic dose of I-131 TST.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare thyroid hormone (TH) metabolism and homeostasis between humans and teleost fish, focusing on differences in T4 uptake and iodine conservation mechanisms.
results_summary: The study found that teleost fish exhibit potent intestinal T4 deiodination and limited plasma T4 uptake, unlike humans, who efficiently absorb and store ingested T4 due to enterohepatic recycling and a large plasma T4 pool. These differences likely evolved to meet species-specific iodine conservation needs.
population_specificity: Humans and teleost fish (trout).

study_goal: The study aimed to compare soil-transmitted helminth (STH) infections between Negrito Orang Asli communities living in inland jungle villages versus resettlement areas, using iodine wet mount among other diagnostic methods.
results_summary: The study found higher STH prevalence in inland jungle villages (91.3%) compared to resettlement areas (83.1%), but severe Trichuris trichiura infections were more common in resettlement areas (17.2% vs. 6.5%). Iodine wet mount was used as a diagnostic tool, but its efficacy or safety was not the focus.
population_specificity: Negrito Orang Asli communities in Malaysia, divided into inland jungle villages and resettlement areas.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of multiple micronutrient (MM) supplementation, including iodine, compared to iron-folic acid (IFA) on late pregnancy micronutrient status in rural Bangladeshi women.
results_summary: The study found a low baseline iodine deficiency prevalence (2.6%) among participants. MM supplementation improved several micronutrient status indicators, but iodine-specific effects were not detailed beyond baseline deficiency rates.
population_specificity: Pregnant women in rural Bangladesh.
effective_dosage: Approximately 1 RDA of iodine (specific amount not stated), provided daily as part of a 15-nutrient MM supplement.
study_duration: From pregnancy ascertainment (around 10 weeks gestation) until 32 weeks gestation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess and improve iodine deficiency status in lactating women and their toddlers in northern Ghana through weekly iodized salt supply and community-based feeding of Hibiscus Sabdariffaa leaves meal prepared with iodized salt.
results_summary: The intervention significantly increased median urinary iodine concentration (UIC) in the intervention group compared to controls, suggesting that weekly iodized salt supply with Hibiscus Sabdariffaa leaves meal is effective for improving iodine status in vulnerable populations. However, baseline UIC values were below recommended levels, indicating persistent iodine deficiency despite universal salt iodization policies.
population_specificity: Lactating women and their toddlers in northern Ghana, a geographically and socioeconomically vulnerable region.
effective_dosage: Weekly supply of household iodized salt and community-based feeding of Hibiscus Sabdariffaa leaves meal prepared with iodized salt.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of dual-energy CT (DECT) texture analysis, including iodine material decomposition maps, in predicting cervical lymphadenopathy in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC) patients.
results_summary: Multi-energy DECT texture analysis, incorporating iodine maps, achieved high accuracy (up to 88%) in predicting nodal metastases, outperforming single-energy (65 keV) analysis. The study concluded that multi-energy analysis provides superior diagnostic information compared to single-energy or iodine maps alone.
population_specificity: 87 patients with head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC).
effective_dosage: Not specified (iodine used in material decomposition maps, not as a supplement).
study_duration: Not specified (retrospective analysis of imaging data).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare bowel labeling, opacification, and taste preference between standard and reduced concentrations of iodinated oral contrast medium (ICM) and barium-based contrast medium (BCM) at different CT scan settings.
results_summary: The study compared ICM at standard (7.2 g iodine) and reduced (5.4 g iodine) concentrations with BCM, focusing on imaging outcomes at low tube voltage or low-energy virtual monochromatic images. Results suggested potential for reduced iodine concentration without compromising diagnostic quality.
population_specificity: 200 adults (97 men, 103 women; mean age 63 ± 13 years) weighing less than 113 kg undergoing oncologic surveillance.
study_duration: Single administration during CT scans (April 2017 to July 2018).

study_goal: The researchers compared the use of stable iodine in cases of radioiodine exposure between China and Germany, focusing on its timing and effectiveness.
results_summary: The study found that stable iodine is effective for radioiodine exposure if administered within several hours, with similar usage in both China and Germany. No significant differences in efficacy were noted between the two countries.
population_specificity: Individuals exposed to radioiodine due to incidents at nuclear power plants or recycling facilities.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the clinical outcomes of patients with intermediate-to-high-risk differentiated thyroid carcinoma (DTC) who received low-dose versus high-dose radioactive iodine (RAI) ablation after thyroidectomy.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in RAI ablation success rates between low-dose and high-dose groups overall, but high-dose therapy showed a trend toward better outcomes in high-risk patients.
population_specificity: Patients with intermediate-to-high-risk DTC who underwent thyroidectomy and RAI ablation without macroscopic residual or metastatic lesions.
effective_dosage: Low-dose therapy was defined as 1110 MBq; high-dose specifics were not detailed in the abstract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of combining transcatheter arterial chemoembolization (TACE) with iodine-125 for treating advanced hepatocellular carcinoma with portal vein tumor thrombus (PVTT).
results_summary: The meta-analysis of eight studies involving 1098 patients showed that TACE plus iodine-125 improved remission rates and overall survival compared to TACE alone, with secondary benefits in portal venous pressure and adverse event profiles.
population_specificity: Patients with advanced hepatocellular carcinoma and portal vein tumor thrombus (PVTT).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of various antiseptic solutions, including iodine-based formulations, for reducing infectious complications like endometritis after cesarean delivery.
results_summary: Povidone-iodine (1%) was the most effective treatment for preventing endometritis, with significant reductions in postoperative wound infections and fever. Other antiseptics also reduced infection rates but were less effective than povidone-iodine.
population_specificity: Women undergoing cesarean delivery, including subgroups in labor, with ruptured membranes, or undergoing planned cesarean delivery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize recent evidence on the effects of micronutrients, including iodine, on brain development and neurocognitive outcomes.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that early-life nutrition, including adequate micronutrient intake, influences neurodevelopment, cognitive performance, and disease risk, but does not specify iodine's unique effects. It suggests dietary interventions may optimize neurodevelopmental outcomes but calls for more clinical trial data.
population_specificity: Preconceptional, pregnant, lactating women, and children in early life.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze strategies and new materials, including iodine-coating, for infection prevention in musculoskeletal oncology surgery.
results_summary: Iodine-coating implants demonstrated efficacy against early infections, associated with lower risk of implant removal and amputation as final surgery. However, there is no evidence that these new materials drastically decrease infection risk.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing orthopaedic oncology surgery, particularly those at high risk of post-operative infections.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the advantages and disadvantages of cardiac imaging techniques (CCT and CMR) for diagnosing and guiding treatment of atrial fibrillation, noting the use of iodine contrast in CCT.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that CCT offers high spatial resolution but requires iodine contrast and involves radiation exposure, while CMR provides tissue characterization without radiation but has longer scan times and lower availability.
population_specificity: Patients with atrial fibrillation requiring diagnostic imaging or treatment guidance.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare direct and indirect radioiodination methods for labeling DARPin G3 to determine the optimal approach for high-contrast imaging of HER2 expression in cancer.
results_summary: Direct radioiodination of DARPin G3 provided higher tumor-to-blood and tumor-to-organ ratios compared to indirect labeling, demonstrating superior imaging contrast for HER2 expression in SKOV3 xenografts. The study confirmed the feasibility of high-contrast PET/CT imaging using [124I]I-G3-H6.
population_specificity: Mice bearing HER2-expressing SKOV3 xenografts.
study_duration: Imaging and biodistribution assessed at 4 hours post-injection.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the diagnostic criteria and clinical management implications of noninvasive follicular thyroid neoplasm with papillary-like nuclear features (NIFTP), previously termed non-invasive encapsulated follicular variant of papillary thyroid carcinomas (NI-EFVPC).
results_summary: The study found that NIFTPs are biologically similar to follicular adenomas with no lymph node metastases or recurrence, leading to a shift in clinical management toward conservative lobectomy without radioactive iodine treatment. Recent revisions in diagnostic criteria emphasize stringent histomorphologic parameters to ensure accurate diagnosis.
population_specificity: Patients with thyroid nodules, specifically those diagnosed with or suspected of having NIFTP/NI-EFVPC.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of recombinant human thyrotropin (rhTSH) plus 3.7 GBq versus thyroid hormone withdrawal (THW) plus 5.55 GBq for adjuvant radioactive iodine (RAI) therapy in differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC) patients with T4 or N1b disease.
results_summary: The study found no differences in TSH-stimulated thyroglobulin levels, incomplete response rates, or recurrence-free survival between the two treatment strategies. However, thyroid bed uptake was more frequently observed in the rhTSH plus 3.7 GBq group compared to the THW plus 5.55 GBq group.
population_specificity: 253 DTC patients with T4 or N1b disease.
